objectDesc.p: Handwritten letter from Mrs. E. C. Jenkins, Secretary/Treasurer of Jenkins Orphanage Institute, to Eartha M. M. White on 11/7/1928 soliciting donations.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Archive." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.p:
There are five (5) sections, Jenkins Orphan Bands No. 1, No. 2, No. 3, No 4 and No. 5number one, number two, number three, number four, and number five and two Jubilee Con
cert Companies of Girls that are talented musicians, 100 strong, that go out each summer when school clos
es to raise funds for the institution. They are invited to all portions of the country, in Europe as well when
transportation is sent in advance. For immediate answer send stamps.

I do not know when I have felt as I do now over the little
orphan and destitute boys and girls in the Jenkins Orphanage.
When I see more than two hundred mouths to be fed daily in the
Home and as many to be clothed: the buildings to be repaired
at a cost of more than ten thousand dollars with no income from
city and state, my hear bleeds for Rev.D.J.Jenkins, whose heart
is centered in the welfare of the children.

The drive is now on to raise $10,000 to make necessary
repairs and have the buildings comfortable before the winter sets
in.

I am writing you and a few others who, I believe, will
make a little sacrifice to aid in this drive. My apportionment
is five hundred dollars. Will you help me in this effort to help
a worthy charity? Kindly let me hear from you at once as I shall
be looking until I hear from you with whatever you find in your
heart to give.
